001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003/**
004 * A very simple point hash meant only for fixed-size grids, and only for when the hash must be unique but does
005 * not need to be randomized. If a hashed collection such as a Map has sufficient capacity to hold all items on
006 * a grid without resizing, then this should never collide when only entering the items on that grid. If any of
007 * the methods that need more than two dimensions of input are called, this delegates to {@link IntPointHash}.
008 * <br>
009 * Based heavily on GoRogue/SadConsole/TheSadRogue.Primitives and
010 * <a href="https://github.com/thesadrogue/TheSadRogue.Primitives/blob/master/TheSadRogue.Primitives/PointHashers/KnownSizeHasher.cs">its KnownSizeHasher</a>.
011 */
012public class KnownSizePointHash extends IPointHash.IntImpl {
013
014    public final int width;
015    /**
016     * Creates a KnownSizePointHash with a grid width of 80.
017     */
018    public KnownSizePointHash() {
019        this(42, 80);
020    }
021
022    /**
023     * Creates a KnownSizePointHash with the specified grid width; the grid height doesn't matter.
024     * @param width how many cells wide the known grid is
025     */
026    public KnownSizePointHash(int width) {
027        this(42, width);
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * Creates a KnownSizePointHash with the specified state and grid width; the grid height doesn't matter.
032     * @param state the state of the point hash, which has minimal effect on the result (it is XORed in)
033     * @param width how many cells wide the known grid is
034     */
035    public KnownSizePointHash(int state, int width) {
036        super(state);
037        this.width = width;
038    }
039
040    @Override
041    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
042        return x + width * y ^ state;
043    }
044
045    @Override
046    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
047        return IntPointHash.hashAll(x, y, z, state);
048    }
049
050    @Override
051    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
052        return IntPointHash.hashAll(x, y, z, w, state);
053    }
054
055    @Override
056    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
057        return IntPointHash.hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, state);
058    }
059
060    @Override
061    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
062        return IntPointHash.hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, v, state);
063    }
064}
